title: Economics of Poverty, Discrimination and Immigration
description: Economic analysis of the cause, extent and impact of poverty, discrimination and immigration and of the policies designed to address these socioeconomic issues. Emphasis on the experience of African-Americans, Latinos, and women in the United States. 4 lectures. Crosslisted as ECON/HNRSÂ 303. Fulfills GE D5 except for Economics majors. Fulfills USCP.
prerequisites: Junior standing; completion of GE Areas A, D1, and either ECON 221 and ECON 222, or ECON 201
